posts.name: Rowan Flood
posts.cooked: How do I see the video for the first time a match was played, if it got replayed? I can’t find a link on the blue alliance. Specifically, match 11, Round 4 of the playoffs in the Northern Lights Regional

posts.name: Zachary
posts.cooked: In the words of Daryl Hall & John Oates:

posts.name: paulonis
posts.cooked: Look at the VOD from the Northern Lights Twitch stream on Saturday around 6:45 into the stream.  These VODs evaporate after a while, so don’t wait too long to grab the clip you want.
If your wondering what the field fault was look closely at 111 WildStangs

posts.name: Asher Olgeirson
posts.cooked: More specially, the FMS kept disconnecting blue

posts.name: Rowan Flood
posts.cooked: I found it from the VODs, thanks!

posts.name: alst
posts.cooked:
Also, from https://community.firstinspires.org/2025-notes-heading-into-week-1:

We will also post the full stream for each day on YouTube to make it easier for teams to find footage from ceremonies, between matches, and awards.

This should cover what you want, although I don’t know when those videos will be posted. I don’t see any up from week 1 events yet.

posts.name: John Christiansen
posts.cooked: I’m curious how this will work.  The Minnesota regionals were playing some pretty mainstream music between matches (including I’m pretty sure some Kanye… )

Best case scenario, the music and other sounds are encoded as separate audio channels and can be easily separated, otherwise they’ll just have to cover over any copyrighted music. Worst case, of course, YouTube just takes the VODs down completely.

posts.name: Aaron Calkins
posts.cooked: In a similar situation, I was able to find the match on the Twitch replay and screen record it for my own use.

posts.name: Robin
posts.cooked: Here’s the YouTube video for the complete day: https://youtu.be/Ff06ho7M90w?si=eurh7DrjERW4AV0w&t=19589 . It should stay on YouTube after the Twitch VOD gets deleted.
